how to calculate: annual maximum bottom water temperature (lowest point/grid)
annual minimum bottom water temperature (lowest point/grid)
annual maximum surface water temperature (at surface)
annual mean surface water temperature (at surface)
annual minimum surface water temperature (at surface)
annual mean heat stored in lake. calculated from volume averaged temperature and heat capacity of water.
first day with ice cover in the period from 1.Okt to 30 Sept
last day with ice cover in the period from 1.Okt to 30 Sept
Number of days with ice cover in the period from 1.Okt to 30 Sept
Annual mean mixed layer depth. Calculated as depth with 0.1 kg/m^3 density difference from surface (linear interpolation) during stratification period.

First day of stratification per year. Lake is considered as stratified if difference in water density between surface and botom > 0.1 kg/m^3 , for lakes in the southern hemisphere use 1.Okt to 30. Sept as year.

Last day of stratification per year. Lake is considered as stratified if difference in water density between surface and botom > 0.1 kg/m^3 , for lakes in the southern hemisphere use 1.Okt to 30. Sept as year.

Number of days with stratification per year. Lake is considered as stratified if difference in water density between surface and botom > 0.1 kg/m^3 , for lakes in the southern hemisphere use 1.Okt to 30. Sept as year.
annual mean difference in surface and bottom temperature on stratified days (when density difference between bottom and surface is > 0.1 kg/m^3)
plot_name: Mean diff. in surface and bottom temp (°C)
